title: Test Git-JSON Storage Implementation
description: Test the git-json storage implementation by configuring this repository to use git-based storage and validating that devlog entries can be saved and retrieved from JSON files in the .devlog/ directory

context.businessContext: This is critical for our long-term memory strategy - we need to ensure that devlog entries are persisted in the git repository so they remain accessible across workspaces and provide historical tracking of our development decisions and progress
context.technicalContext: Phase 1 and Phase 2 of git storage implementation are complete. We have GitStorageProvider, repository structure management, and JSON file operations implemented. Now we need to test the end-to-end workflow by switching from sqlite to git-json storage
acceptanceCriteria: Configure repository to use git-json storage
Verify existing devlog entries are accessible
Create new devlog entries in JSON format
Confirm entries are properly committed to git
Test basic operations: create, read, update, list entries

keyInsights: Implementation is complete based on devlog ID 7 context
MCP tools for git repository management are implemented
Need to backup current SQLite data before switching
